name: touchiness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of needing to be dealt with carefully because people may be offended or upset: Everyone is aware of the touchiness of the situation . The advisers wouldn't be identified because of the touchiness of the subject.
the quality of being easily offended or upset: My opponent's touchiness every time he is questioned should make us more concerned. These people blame others, but fail to recognize their own insecurities and touchiness. See
touchy
More examplesFewer examplesFor researchers, the touchiness of the topic is a challenge. There is a painful touchiness in all aspects of the subject.Recalling the boss's touchiness on the subject, he dismissed the idea.
